author: Zoe Shenton
title: Watch Fifth Harmony's first performance as a four-piece as group take to the stage at the People's Choice Awards
text:
Fifth Harmony debuted its new four-woman line-up at Wednesday's People's Choice Awards. 
The band took to the stage at the Microsoft Theatre for the first time since Camila Cabello ’s shock departure last month. 
And the girls – Lauren, Ally, Dinah and Normani – dazzled with a powerful performance of huge hit Work From Home. 
They also scooped the People's Choice gong for Favourite Group. 
"We'd be nothing without you, please believe that," Normani said as they collected their gong. (L-R) Singers Dinah Jane, Lauren Jauregui, Normani Kordei, and Ally Brooke of Fifth Harmony perform onstage (Photo: FilmMagic, Inc) (L-R) Singers Ally Brooke, Normani Kordei, Lauren Jauregui, and Dinah Jane of Fifth Harmony (Photo: WireImage) 
Fifth Harmony fans were stunned in December when Camila left the group, which found fame on the second series of X Factor USA in 2012. 
The group announced Camila’s departure via their Instagram account, saying: “After 4 and a half years of being together, we have been informed via her representatives that Camila has decided to leave Fifth Harmony. We wish her well." 
That kicked off a war of words between Camila and the group - she insisted they’d known for a while she wanted to leave, while the band suggested that wasn’t the case. (L-R) Singers Dinah Jane, Lauren Jauregui, Normani Kordei, and Ally Brooke of Fifth Harmony on stage (Photo: WireImage) 
Camila said she was “shocked” by Fifth Harmony’s statement , telling fans: “The girls were aware of my feelings through the long, much needed conversations about the future that we had during our tour. Saying that they were just informed through my representatives that I was ‘leaving the group’ is simply not true.” 
"Just like the other girls said in their statement about their plans, I had also planned to continue with my own solo endeavours in the New Year, but I did not intend to end things with Fifth Harmony this way,” she added. (L-R) Singers Ally Brooke, Normani Kordei, Lauren Jauregui, and Dinah Jane of Fifth Harmony on stage (Photo: WireImage) 
The group, however, hit back with a statement of their own disagreeing with Camila’s take on the situation. 
“Over the past several months we have consistently made every effort to sit down and discuss the future of Fifth Harmony with Camila,” they said. 
“We have spent the past year and a half (since her initial solo endeavor) trying to communicate to her and her team all of the reasons why we felt Fifth Harmony deserved at least one more album of her time, given the success of this past year that we’d all worked so hard for." (L-R) Recording artists Ally Brooke, Normani Hamilton, Dinah Jane Hansen and Lauren Jauregui of Fifth Harmony (Photo: WireImage) 
"We called for group meetings which she refused, we asked L.A. Reid and the label to step in and try to set meetings, which again, she refused. We even went as far as group counseling which she did not show up to. So no, after months of rejection from her and her team, these supposed lengthy conversations in fact never happened, although we pleased. 
"We have tried with exhausted efforts and hearts to keep this group alive as the five of us, and we want it to be very clear that unfortunately those efforts were not mutual."
